meanings.definition: Not sober; not fully conscious or aware of one's surroundings due to the influence of alcohol or drugs.
meanings.sent1: After drinking too much, he felt unsober and couldn't walk straight.
meanings.sent2: She realized she was unsober when she couldn't remember how she got home.
meanings.sent3: The unsober man tried to dance on the table but ended up falling off.
meanings.sent4: The unsober world seemed to spin around him, distorting reality.
meanings.sent5: The unsober state clouded his judgment, leading to regrettable decisions.

meanings.definition: Lacking sobriety; not mentally or emotionally stable.
meanings.sent1: Her unsober mind was filled with chaotic thoughts and emotions.
meanings.sent2: The unsober individual struggled to make rational decisions.
meanings.sent3: The unsober clown kept tripping over his own oversized shoes.
meanings.sent4: His unsober behavior at work raised concerns among his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The unsober atmosphere in the room made everyone uneasy.
